events.name: [Industry Insights] Tech Talks with Mr Christopher Hall, BNY Mellon
events.description:
Tech Talks [industry insights] is a series by MAS where leaders from the FinTech industry share deep insights on key issues and emerging trends within our financial sector.
The Evolving Landscape of Cybersecurity: Strategy that Drives Innovation while Balancing Security and Building Customer Trust
Financial Institutions are continuously challenged with tough regulations, disjointed business operations, changing customer expectations, increasing competition, digital advances and most importantly - evolving & increasing complex cyber threats. It is very clear that the future of the innovation and global economy depends on the trusted and secure cyber space. 
In this regard, cybersecurity plays a strategic role in providing the cover that financial institutions need in order to conduct business efficiently.
 
About the speaker
Christopher Hall is the Deputy Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) and Managing Director for Global Cybersecurity Strategy and Innovation at the Bank of New York Mellon.  
 In this role, Christopher is responsible for overseeing the governance and strategy of the Cybersecurity Service Program, which is based on a comprehensive set of international standards that qualifies and quantifies security services into 23 control families utilizing a risk reduction framework that ensures core and significant assets are appropriately protected.
Mr. Hall has a MBA in Technology Management and a Master of Science in Information Assurance from Norwich University. He holds multiple active certifications to include Certified Information System Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), and he is a credentialed Project Management Professional (PMP) with 25 years of management and leadership experience.
He has a proven track record of innovation and the ability to influence senior decision makers to efficiently implement next-generation cyber security controls and processes that enable the business to leverage emerging technologies that create new revenue streams and reduce costs.
Mr Hall has been a featured speaker at several industry organizations to include Information Systems Audit and Control Association (ISACA), Securing Our eCity, and the Information Systems Security Association (ISSA) on a wide-range of Information Assurance programs and initiatives. He is a subject matter expert in Key Management, Crypto, Computer Network Defense, as well as, Cybersecurity program development and implementation.
events.location: BNY Mellon, Singapore Branch, 1 Temasek Avenue, #07-01 Millenia Tower, Innovation Centre, Singapore 039192

events.name: Social Coding
events.description: A space for women coders to learn from each other, to practice and discuss learnings with fellow peers. This would be a weekly event of informal space to do coding. So bring your pet projects along or join one of our existing teams/ projects to work on. Featured Projects:https://trello.com/b/kl2BTwil/wwc-sg-social-coding-projects First timers, please read:Newbies Step-by-step Guide Please bring your own laptop. Agenda:6:30p - Registration and Introduce projects7:00p - Break out into groups and Start coding! ^_^8:30p - End session There is no food provided, so please make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, we recommend to bring your own water bottle along. Psst, this event is intended for ladies only. Host:
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: Business Agility: Creating the Future
events.description: We're pleased to announce a meetup with Pat Reed, Agile leadership thought leader. She would be talking aboutneed for Business Agility and Adaptive Leadership for enterprise transformation! Please RSVP on Meetup with your Name, Company and Nationality. This event is free. PROGRAM • 6:30 pm Welcome networking with refreshments • 7:00 pm Presentation followed by Q&A SUMMARY The need for agility has never been more pronounced. In today’s dynamic and fast-moving world, some of the biggest companies that exist today didn’t exist five years ago. Some of the biggest brands have been disrupted to the point of extinction. The tools that served us well in the past don’t necessarily still apply – volatility, uncertainty, complexity and ambiguity are challenging much of what we know. People at every level in today’s organisations need to focus on customer delight, and bring innovation and continuous learning into our work. This requires us to shed our old practices that are holding us back, and to harness agility to re-imagine the future of our organisations. ABOUT THE PRESENTER: PAT REED This session is presented by Pat Reed, an Agile transformational leader in Adaptive Leadership and Value Innovation. Pat Reed is an experienced Agile executive, coach, transformational leader and adjunct professor at UC Berkley. Pat has proven success transforming large Agile organisations and developing world class enterprise Agile practices. Her substantial experience includes roles with Disney, Gap, NBC Universal, GameWorks. http://agileleadershipacademy.com/pat-reed/
events.location: IBM Studio, MBFC Tower 2, Level 42, 10 Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018983

events.name: Book Club: From NAND to Tetris II – Compiler II: Code Generation
events.description: Read The Elements of of Computing Systems and/or follow the Coursera course Build a Modern Computer from First Principles: From Nand to Tetris Part II.  This week we'll be covering chapter 11. Compiler II: Code Generation (week 5 of the course) and the project from chapter 10 / week 4.  "I did the coursework because understanding computers is important to me, just like literacy and numeracy, and I made it through. I never worked harder on anything, never been challenged to this degree. But given what I now feel capable of doing, I would certainly do it again. To anyone considering NAND2Tetris, it's a tough journey, but you'll be profoundly changed." Shimon Schocken, the author of the book talks about the course at TED: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iE7YRHxwoDs How Book Club Works1. Read the chapter and try out (better yet, complete) this week's course homework before you come to the meetup.2. Find something in the chapter you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting.4. Group discussion and banter ensues! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore  437032Singapore Doors open at 7:00, meetup starts at 7:30. Bring snacks and drinks of your choice!  FAQ Do I have to take Nand to Tetris Part I before taking Nand to Tetris Part II? From the Coursera course FAQ: "Nand to Tetris Part I and Nand to Tetris Part II are two separate and stand alone courses. Although it is recommended to take Part I before taking Part II, you can take any of these courses, in any order that suites you." Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS bookclub gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions/bookclub Useful Links • NAND to Tetris website: http://www.nand2tetris.org/ • Get the book: http://www.amazon.com/Elements-Computing-Systems-Building-Principles/dp/0262640686/ • Coursera course: https://www.coursera.org/learn/nand2tetris2
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore
